(Simplified: 励)
Pictophonetic: 厲 indicates the sound; 力 (strength) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 厲 [ lì ] whetstone; to grind, to sharpen, to whet
    • 力 [ lì ] strength, power; capability, influence
heisig_chinese_memo: Ten thousand stern Persians are at the base of the cliff, but the leader of the 300 Spartans just flexes his huge muscles and encourages his men by shouting that they have the power to fight them all.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Ten thousand Persians are at the base of the cliff, but the leader of the 300 Spartans just flexes his huge muscles and encourages his men by shouting that they have the power to fight them all.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " strength " and " 10,000 ", the original meaning is encouragement and encouragement. "Said Wen": "I can do my best. The Book of the Week" says: "I use my power to show my country. Reading like ten thousand. Working hard and ten thousand voices."

" Encouragement " can mean excitement. "The Biography of Chen Shu‧Fu Xi": "A guest who breathes and looks forward, a person who kisses each other with his lips and kisses, is strong and bright, and wing.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " strength " and " ten thousand ", the original meaning is encouragement and encouragement.
humanum_full_description:
從「力」，「萬」聲，本義為勉勵、鼓勵。《說文》：「勉力也。《周書》曰：用勱相我邦家。讀若萬。从力，萬聲。」《國語‧吳語》：「請王勵士，以奮其朋勢。」

　　「勵」可表示振奮。《陳書‧傅縡傳》：「呼吸顧望之客，唇吻縱橫之士，奮鋒穎，勵羽翼。」
humanum_short_description: 從「力」，「萬」聲，本義為勉勵、鼓勵。

勵字的基本解释

勵
lì
见“励”。

勵字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lì］
［《廣韻》力制切，去祭，來。］
“励1”的繁体字。
(1)劝勉，鼓励。
(2)推崇，尊重。
(3)奋；振奋。
(4)通“礪”。砥砺，磨炼。参见“勵節”。
(5)通“厲”。猛烈。
(6)姓。东汉有魏郡太守励温。见《元和姓纂·八霁》。

勵字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【力字部】　勵； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页149第44
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?力制切，音厲。【說文】勉力也，从力厲聲。【玉篇】勸也。【廣韻】勸勉也。【後漢·祭彤傳】璽書勉勵。又【韻會】通作厲。有修飾振起意。【前漢·宣帝紀】厲精更始。

勵字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
勵字的起名意思

暂无。

Encourage
Basic explanation of words
Encourage
lì
See "Encouragement".
Encourage
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lì］
["Guangyun" force cutting, go to sacrifice, come. ]
Traditional characters of "励1".
(1) Encourage and encourage.
(2) Respect and respect.
(3) Excited; Excited.
(4) Through "grinding". Hardened, tempered. See "Inspirational Festival".
(5) Through "strength". violent.
(6) Last name. There was Li Wen, the prefect of Weijun in the Eastern Han Dynasty. See "Yuanhe Surname Compilation·Eight Ji".
Encourage
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset 2] [Li Zi Department] 　 Li; Kangxi strokes: 17; Page number: page 149 44
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting]? Forced cutting, sharp sound. [Said the text] I can do my best, and make a stern voice. [Jade articles] Persuade also. [Guang Yun] Exhortation too. [Later Han · Jitong Biography] Encouragement by the seal book. And [Rhyme will] make great efforts. There are embellishments to revive. [Previous Han·Xuan Di Ji] Li Jing started.
